conbody.p: The DITA Open Toolkit release 1.2 or above provides a DITA to Word transforming function to transform DITA source files to output in Microsoft Word rtf file. The whole structure of the output file is the same as the structure designed in the ditamap file of the DITA source files.
To avoid losing files in the final output, make sure the ditamap file must contain the completed cross references and all topic, concept, task and reference files which are referenced to.
You can use an ant script to transform DITA source files to word output. See for more details.
You can also use the Java command for transform. See for more details.
See for the supported parameters that you can set with the ant script.
See for the supported parameters that you can set with the Java command.
